instance_deactivate_region: With this function you can define a region within the room to deactivate instances that have previously been activated. This region can either be flagged as "inside" or "outside" as demonstrated in the following image:

instance_deactivate_region.htm+html.head: instance_deactivate_region.htm+html.body.p:88-3
instance_deactivate_region: You can see in the image above that the "apple" instance is always inactive because, even if the sprite itself doesn't overlap the region, the bounding box does. So, instances are considered to be within the region specified when their bounding box overlaps with it, and the state of the collision mask (precise or not) is not taken into consideration. Note that deactivation is not instantaneous, and an instance that has been deactivated in this way will not be considered to be inactive until the end of the event in which the function was called.
